intro: Rapanea taitensis, commonly known as the Taiti hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
